content:
Sure, I can provide some information on the backgrounds of these successful athletes:

1. Matti Nykänen: Nykänen was born in Jyväskylä, Finland in 1963. He started ski jumping at a young age and quickly showed talent. He won his first international competition at the age of 17 and went on to become one of the greatest ski jumpers of all time, winning a total of five Olympic medals (four golds and a silver) and nine World Championship medals (five golds, three silvers, and a bronze) in his career.

2. Yvonne van Gennip: Van Gennip was born in Haarlem, Netherlands in 1964. She originally started playing basketball but switched to speed skating at the age of 19. She quickly showed promise and went on to win three gold medals at the 1988 Olympics. She continued to be successful in the sport, winning several World Championship titles and setting world records.

3. Alberto Tomba: Tomba was born in San Lazzaro di Savena, Italy in 1966. He started skiing at a young age and quickly became a top competitor. He won his first Olympic gold medal in 1988 at the age of 21 and went on to become one of the most successful alpine skiers in history. He won a total of three Olympic gold medals, two World Championship gold medals, and numerous other titles and awards throughout his career.
